page.title: 09Rochford Fair.
page.content: Rochford Fair has been described in the press as "the town's entertainment extravaganza". The show is jointly organised by David Keddie, who owns a large department store in Southend and Rochford Council. This year it is estimated that more than 15,000 people attended the show. As well as an abundance of the usual fete side- stalls and stands, the Red Devil Parachute Team performed and there was a display by the Marlboro bi-plane fliers, helicopter rides, go-cart racing plus a display of traction engines. The show was also a valuable platform for local industry as several local businesses took stands. There was entertainment to suit everybody and it is becoming a very popular local event. It is also nice to know that the show has helped to raise money for several local charities.
